title: Add Table Load Management
objective: Learn how to use the 'housekeeping cycle' to manage table loads and how to
provide a function that validates a table's content prior to it being activated.

exercise.instructions: 1. Add the table validation macro definition from the exercise window.

1. At the end of the event message identifier list add:
    #define @TEMPLATE@_TABLE_VALIDATE_ERR_EID    9

Note this is the event ID for the event message sent when the command is processed.

1. Locate the 'Local functions' comment block added in the previous lesson. Add the table validation function prototype:
    static int32 ValidateExampleTbl(void *TblData);

1. Locate the CFE_TBL_Register() added to @TEMPLATE@_Init) in the previous lesson. Change the NULL parameter to
    ValidateExampleTbl

1. Locate the @TEMPLATE@_ReportHousekeeping() function and before the return statement add:
    CFE_TBL_Manage(@TEMPLATE@_Data.TblHandle);

This function checks for pending table loads. If one exists then
 the app's validation function is called if one was provided during registration.
1. Go to the end of the file and add the ValidateExampleTbl() function from the exercise window.
